page.title: 02ALL SAINTS'CHURCH SUTTON
page.content: The church dates back to the late 12th century.The chancel was built in C14 and the tower in C15.The village was owned by the Burgoyne family until 1938 so there are memorials to members of that family in the church.There are several interesting features in the church including a Jacobean pulpit,a medieval chest,a double piscina, sedilia and a Sacred barrel organ.The barrel organ is housed in the belfry and is the only working organ of its kind in Bedfordshire.The present Rector is also Vicar of Potton and Cockaine Hatley.Services are held in All Saints'Church on most Sundays.The 9am service is a Holy Communion Service and the 6pm service is Evensong.On the first Sunday in the month,there is a Family Service at 10.15am.
